Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object

public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller for everything related to User models

    • Method Detail

      • getUsers

        @GetMapping(path="/get-users")
public java.util.List<User> getUsers()
        Endpoint to get all users in the database
        Returns:
        List of users, that shows up as a JSON (thanks either Spring or HTTP)

      • getUserByName

        @GetMapping(path="/get-user-by-name")
 @ResponseBody
public User getUserByName(@RequestParam
                                                                               java.lang.String username)
        Gets a User object from the database based on the username specified
        Parameters:
        username - name of user object to retrieve. sent as a url parameter
        Returns:
        User object (but actually JSON version)

      • getUserRole

        @GetMapping(path="/get-role")
public java.lang.String getUserRole(@RequestParam
                                                                  java.lang.String username)
        Gets the role of a user specified as a parameter
        Parameters:
        username - String of username of a User object to check the role of (sent as url parameter)
        Returns:
        String of the role of the user, or a string specifying that the user doesn't exist

      • checkUserExists

        @GetMapping(path="/user-exists")
 @ResponseBody
public boolean checkUserExists(@RequestParam
                                                                               java.lang.String username)
        Check if the user exists via request. Likely soon to be deprecated b/c of login
        Parameters:
        username - String url parameter of the username portion of a User object you're checking that exists
        Returns:
        boolean based on if user exists or not

      • createUser

        @PostMapping(path="/add-user",
             produces="application/json",
             consumes="application/json")
 @ResponseBody
public java.lang.String createUser(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                     User u)
                                                                                                                                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a user to the database
        Parameters:
        u - User object, with only the username and password
        Returns:
        String saying that either the user exists, or that a user with that username already exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if username is already taken, don't add this user and throw this exception instead

      • login

        @PostMapping(path="/login",
             produces="application/json",
             consumes="application/json")
 @ResponseBody
public java.lang.String login(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                             User u)
        endpoint used for logging in
        Parameters:
        u - User object containing ONLY username and password
        Returns:
        String saying that the user doesn't exist, the password was correct, or the password was incorrect
        See Also:
        UserService
